page.title: 05HOUSING IN PARR.
page.content: Residences in the area number approximately five and a half thousand of which 1,800 are owner occupied, the rest rented property, mostly council housing. Most residences are houses, with a tiny proportion of flats and maisonettes but no high rise flats whatever. Of the owner-occupied housing, 150 lacked a bathroom in 1981 and 190 had no inside toilet. This is an indication of the continued existence of mid to late nineteenth century housing, despite a clearance and rebuilding programme in the past decade. Other housing includes 1930's semi-detached and modern housing estates, both private and council property. Much of the latter is town housing interspersed with bungalows for older people. Many of the redevelopment areas have been renamed to give an appealing impression.
